articles.title: OpenAI’s letter to Governor Newsom on harmonized regulation
articles.desc: We’ve just sent a letter to Gov. Gavin Newsom calling for California to lead the way in harmonizing state-based AI regulation with national—and, by virtue of US leadership, emerging global—standards.

articles.title: Scaling accounting capacity with OpenAI
articles.desc: Built with OpenAI o3, o3-Pro, GPT-4.1, and GPT-5, Basis’ AI agents help accounting firms save up to 30% of their time and expand capacity for advisory and growth.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5 for developers
articles.desc: Introducing GPT-5 in our API platform—offering high reasoning performance, new controls for devs, and best-in-class results on real coding tasks.

articles.title: Claude API Status: Operational
articles.desc: API services running normally with Claude models available

articles.title: How AI is helping advance the science of bioacoustics to save endangered species
articles.desc: Our new Perch model helps conservationists analyze audio faster to protect endangered species, from Hawaiian honeycreepers to coral reefs.

articles.title: Genie 3: A new frontier for world models
articles.desc: Genie 3 can generate dynamic worlds that you can navigate in real time at 24 frames per second, retaining consistency for a few minutes at a resolution of 720p.

articles.title: Rethinking how we measure AI intelligence
articles.desc: Game Arena is a new, open-source platform for rigorous evaluation of AI models. It allows for head-to-head comparison of frontier systems in environments with clear winning conditions.

articles.desc: OpenAI is positioning GPT-5 not only as a more powerful AI model but also as part of a more connected workspace.

articles.title: Anthropic just made its latest move in the AI coding wars

articles.title: AI companion apps on track to pull in $120M in 2025
articles.desc: The number of AI companion apps has grown more than 60% since 2024.

articles.title: Perplexity offers to buy Chrome for billions more than it's raised | TechCrunch
articles.desc: Perplexity has offered to buy Chrome from Google for $34.5 billion cash in an unsolicited offer.
